intro: Lastrea subochthodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lastrea, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for dry environments. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
